|brand = Netgear |model = R7000 |submodelappend = <!-- yes, for space --> |submodel = <!-- SubModel number, Leave blank for unknown --> |revision = <!-- Model Revision, Leave blank for none or unknown --> |subrevision = <!-- Model Subrevision, Leave blank for none or unknown --> |model_part_num = |page_start_date = |page_start_origon = |wlclass = AC1900 |series = Nighthawk |type = wireless router |sernum = <!-- First 4 or so for easy version identification --> |fcc_id = PY313200233, PY318300420 |icid = 4054A-13200233, 4054A-18300420 |us_id = <!-- US ID number --> |boardid = U12H270T00_NETGEAR |ecc_id = <!-- eec-id -->
|cpu1chip1 = Broadcom;BCM4709A0;BCM4709A0KFEBG, TT1308, P10, E9MCJ-01, Z1C; |cpu1_cores = 2 |cpu1_type = ARMv7 |cpu1_type_rev = Cortex-A9 (rev 0 v7l) |cpu1spd = 1.0 GHz |is_doc = |bus = <!-- 8-bit, 16-bit, 32-bit, 64-bit, Leave blank for none -->
|flash1type = <!-- Parallel,Serial(SPI),NAND,Compact Flash --> |fla1_num = <!-- 1,2,3,4 --> |fla1chip = Samsung;K9F1G08U0D; |flash1size = 128 |flash1maxsize = <!-- Maximum size firmware can be in bytes -->
|ram1type = <!-- DDR,DDR2,DDR3,DDR4 --> |ram1type1 = <!-- SO-DIMM,SDRAM --> |ram1spd = <!-- RAM speed --> |ram1size = 256 |ram1chip = Samsung;K4B2G1646E-BCK0; |ram1_num = <!-- Number of Ram chips --> |nvramsize = <!-- 32, 60, 64, etc... in kb, Leave blank for unknown -->
|eth_cpu = true |sw_cpu = true |wan_ports = 1 |wan_speed = 1GbE |lan_ports = 4 |lan_speed = 1GbE |ethstandard = <!-- auto --> |portbasedvlan = <!-- Support for port based vlan tagging, Leave blank for unknown --> |802.1qvlan = <!-- Support for 802.1q vlan tagging, Leave blank for unknown --> |auto_mdix = <!-- mdix support --> |sup_jumbo = <!-- Jumbo frames support --> |ethoui = 04:A1:51, 44:94:FC |oui = 04:A1:51, 44:94:FC
|bootwait = <!-- On or Off, Leave blank for unknown --> |stockbootloader = CFE;;; |stockos = Linux;;;
|exp_if_types = USB 3.0, USB 2.0 |exp_usb_num = 2 |usb_hub = <!-- USB hub compatibility -->
|pwr_volt_type = VDC |pwr_vdc = 12 |pwr_amp_dc = 3.5 |pwr_conn = barrel |pwr_barrel_outer = <!-- Outer barrel size in mm --> |pwr_barrel_inner = <!-- Inner barrel size in mm --> |pwr_barrel_len = <!-- Length of barrel --> |pwr_pol = <!-- Connector polarity -->
|serial = yes,, 4-pin header,, internal,, 3.3V TTL |jtag = <!-- Full JTAG info -->
|specialfeat = <!-- Features that don't fit any place else, Leave blank for none --> |flags = <!-- flags, Leave blank for none --> |addchip = 2.4GHz Power Amplifier IC;Skyworks;SE2623L;SKY, 2623L, 322BD;3; ,,, 5GHz Power Amplifier IC;Skyworks;SE5003L1;5003L1, 243BE, 1243 MY;3; |802dot11_protocols = abgn+ac
|defaulip = <!-- ???.???.???.???, default IP Address --> |defaultlogin = admin |defaultpass = password |defaultssid = <!-- default Wireless ID, Leave blank for unknown --> |defaultssid_regex = |default_ch = <!-- Defaults channel(s) Radio(s) are set to --> |manuf = Foxconn |manuf_model = U12H270 |manuf_rev = T00 |is_manuf = No |tpfirmware = FreshTomato-ARM, DD-WRT (Kong-AC ARM), Tomato (Shibby), Tomato RAF (Victek)
|availability = <!-- Market availability --> |eoldate = <!-- End of Life date --> |fccapprovdate = 08/07/2013 |estreldate = <!-- Estimated release date --> |estprice = <!-- Estimated retail price in US dollars --> |upc = 606449099843 |ean = <!-- EAN number --> |dx_sku = <!-- DealExtreme sku --> |newegg = <!-- newegg item number --> |asin = B00F0DD0I6 |asin_country = <!-- ASIN country --> |asin2 = <!-- ASIN number --> |asin_country2 = <!-- ASIN country --> |countrymanuf = China
|buttons = <!-- buttons available --> |led = <!-- Led colors and descriptions --> |dimensions = <!-- Size of device {{convert |length|x|widthordepth|x|height|in|mm}} --> |weight = <!-- Weight of device {{convert|weight|oz|g}} -->
|wi1_if_name = |rad1chip1 = Broadcom;BCM4360;BCM4360KMLG, TE1312, P20, 273016, 3 W; |rad1oui = <!-- Only if different from above OUI --> |rad1_ant_conn = U.FL, RP-SMA |rad1txchains = 3 |rad1rxchains = 3 |rad1sstreams = 3 |rad1stand = IEEE 802.11a/n/ac |rad1ac = 1300 |nqam1 = <!-- 600, 750, 900, 1000 --> |rad1n = 450 |rad1a = 54 |rad1freq = 5 |rad1correv = <!-- core revision, Leave blank for none or unknown --> |rad1cap = <!-- radio capabilities, Leave blank for none or unknown -->
|wi2_if_name = |rad2chip1 = Broadcom;BCM4360;BCM4360KMLG, TE1312, P20, 273016, 3 W; |rad2oui = <!-- Only if different from above OUI --> |rad2_ant_conn = U.FL, RP-SMA |rad2txchains = 3 |rad2rxchains = 3 |rad2sstreams = 3 |rad2stand = IEEE 802.11b/g/n |nqam2 = <!-- 600, 750, 900, 1000 --> |rad2n = 450 |rad2g = 54 |rad2b = 11 |rad2freq = 2.4 |rad2correv = <!-- core revision, Leave blank for none or unknown --> |rad2cap = <!-- radio capabilities, Leave blank for none or unknown -->
}}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== Per the FCC test report... *The device seems to be [[Broadcom]] based :(the testing utility is ''Manual Tool v2.0.1.0'') *The supporting WLAN AC card is stated to use BCM4360
Netgear requested FCC certification for the R7000 again on 12/17/2018 under [https://fccid.io/PY318300420 PY318300420]. This version has been internally redesigned, likely to cut manufacturing costs. Some minor components (RAM/FEM/etc.) may have changed but the same Broadcom chips are still used.<!--{{FCC ST|06/16/2019}}-->
==Links of Interest== ===News=== *[http://www.smallnetbuilder.com/wireless/wireless-news/32229-netgear-joins-the-ac1900-club ''NETGEAR Joins The AC1900 Club'' on '''SmallNetBuilder'''] :[[Broadcom]] BCM4709A0 (''BCM4709A0KFEBG'') + 2x BCM4360 ::There is a single USB 3.0 port on the front of the unit ::and a single USB 2.0 port on the rear of the unit :This device seems to be functionally equivalent ::(or quite similar) to the [[ASUS RT-AC68U]]
===Reviews=== *[http://www.smallnetbuilder.com/wireless/wireless-reviews/32239-ac1900-first-look-netgear-r7000-a-asus-rt-ac68u ''First Look: NETGEAR R7000 & ASUS RT-AC68U'' on '''SmallNetBuilder'''] **"U12H270T00", "801466", "REV.1 GP" is silkscreened on the board **states the device is using [[Broadcom]] BCM4709A + BCM4360 ::3x [[Skyworks]] (''SiGe'') SE2623L PAMs for the 2.4GHz radio ::3x [[Skyworks]] (''SiGe'') SE5003L1 PAMs for the 5GHz radio *[http://reviews.cnet.com/hubs/netgear-nighthawk-ac1900-smart/4505-3335_7-35828277.html ''Netgear Nighthawk AC1900 Smart Wi-Fi Router (R7000)'' on '''C|Net'''] :04:A1:51 OUI, ''NETGEARXX'' SSID, states this device uses BCM4709 *[http://www.pcworld.com/article/2050761/netgear-nighthawk-review-this-802-11ac-router-sets-lan-speed-records.html ''Netgear NightHawk AC1900 Smart R7000 Router'' on '''PCWorld'''] *[https://lookgadgets.com/10-best-wireless-routers/#2_NetGear_NightHawk_AC1900_8211_R7000_Fastest_overall_throughput_and_slick_design ''Netgear NightHawk AC1900 R7000 Router'' on '''LookGadgets''']
===Forum threads=== *[http://www.dd-wrt.com/phpBB2/viewtopic.php?t=177443 ''Netgear R7000'' on the '''DD-WRT''' forums]
==Pictures== <center>'''Retail Images''' <gallery> File:Netgear R7000 01.jpg| File:Netgear R7000 02.jpg| File:Netgear R7000 03.jpg| </gallery></center>[[Has images::retail| ]][[Has images::external| ]]
==See also== *[[Netgear R6900P]] - ''AC2300 Smart WiFi Router'' :• FCC ID: [https://fccid.io/PY316200351 PY316200351] (11/15/2016) 12V/3.5A - 1x USB 3.0 *[[Netgear R7000P]] - ''AC2300 Smart WiFi Router'' :• FCC ID: [https://fccid.io/PY316200351 PY316200351] (11/15/2016) 12V/3.5A - 3T3R BCM
